content:
DSBs at fragile genomic sites promote chromothripsis (massive chromosomal rearrangements), and cancers with high chromothripsis burden display unique vulnerabilities to DNA repair inhibitors.  
*Supporting evidence:* Chromothripsis is associated with DSBs and tumorigenesis [Stephens 2011]. Chromothripsis-associated cancers may be sensitive to DSB repair targeting [Cort√©s-Ciriano 2020, Nat Genet; "Comprehensive analysis of chromothripsis in 2,658 human cancers"].
